I had no idea this game was coming out for the PC at all, much less with Games for Windows-Live support. Wikipedia usually does a good job of listing all achievement-based PC games, but they completely missed this one. As a side note, if you have an Xbox Live membership, you can use that account while playing Games for Window-Live games. Even while playing cracked/pirated versions. You don't sign your profile in online. You play using your profile while offline, but all of the achievements you earn still count. I've done this a lot. It's not going to get your banned. Because if the game is cracked, then you cannot even go online. Microsoft isn't going to know whether you bought it legally or not if you are playing it offline. It is the same thing that people who own modded 360s do. Just don't break the street date and no one will really ever suspect anything.

People who are new to this sort of thing should also note that just because a cracked game is working for some people doesn't mean it is going to work for you, it depends on your hardware and software specs (what chip-set, CPU, etc. you have), also cracked games tend to have a habit of being unstable and may crash occasionally.
And if you like the game then buy it and show the manufacturer your support.

Just wanted to say THANKS!! and to add:

For all of you having problems with Windows Live failing to start,  I had the same problem. Windows Live wouldn't even start and I kept getting some error. I had to uninstall everything (including the game itself) and also had to uninstall Windows Live ID Sign-In Assistant. Took me a while to find out that this was causing me the problem. After I uninstalled everything, I just ran the installer straight from the disk again and everything worked. Created an offline account and enjoyed the game. 

Thanks again for the upload!!!!!!!!!

Install works fine, but I had a problem with the game crashing on startup. I ran the exe from the game directory and it gave me a configuration file error. Installing .NET Framework 3.5 fixed that error and now the game runs fine.

The game has a bug that will corrupt your save games upon exiting, making it impossible to save your game. Sega released a patch to fix this issue but its only available through the Games for Windows LIVE client. A key is required to get this patch and the one provided in the torrent does not work. I'm almost certain SEGA put this bug in the game on purpose to deter piracy.

It would be awesome if skidrow released a torrent of the patched version of this game.
